author: News 9
title: Former OU star tight end Mark Andrews preparing for eighth NFL season with the Ravens
text:
Wednesday, July 23rd 2025, 10:06 pm
It was a tough end to the 2024 season for Baltimore tight end Mark Andrews.
The former Oklahoma star dropped a game-tying two-point conversion late in the fourth quarter of the divisional round of the AFC playoffs against the Bills. Interestingly enough, Andrews and the Ravens will begin the 2025 campaign at Buffalo. Speaking with the media at training camp, Andrews said, "It is going to be a great story. I'm excited about that game."
Entering his eighth year with Baltimore, Andrews is also entering the final year of his contract. However, the former third-round pick isn't looking too far ahead. Andrews said, "It's living in the moment. I'm thankful to be here this year, to be able to compete for this organization and compete for this city. I just want people to know that. It really means everything to me."
His receiving yards last season were down compared to years past, but Andrews still racked up over 670 yards on 55 catches. Andrews, though, did set a new career high with 11 touchdown catches. Andrews is excited for another run with star quarterback Lamar Jackson, saying, "I know the type of player I am, the type of man I am. All those things looking forward, I know they're going to help me grow, get better, be the player I'm meant to be, and get to that end goal which I'm incredibly focused on."
Andrews and Baltimore open the 2025 campaign on Sunday, September 7th at Buffalo on Sunday Night Football.

author: Mirage News
title: Putting Down Roots For National Tree Day | Mirage News
text: Put down some community roots this National Tree Day and sign up for the community planting sessions taking place in Rockhampton on Sunday 28 July. Parks, Sport and Public Spaces Councillor Cherie Rutherford said registrations are now open, with different planting sessions available to choose from. "National Tree Day is an annual initiative that sees over 300,000 people across the country roll up their sleeves and contribute to their community," Cr Rutherford said. "Over the last few years, our community has planted thousands of native plants in our region and the reward for our collective hard work comes as we watch these trees flourish and create a place for both our community and visitors to enjoy in years to come. "We're really excited to be hosting a community planting event again this year and would love to encourage as many as possible to join us at River Rose Drive in Norman Gardens." Division 1 Councillor Shane Latcham said there will be around 600 plants from a dozen native species to be established along a section of the popular footpath. "We regularly rotate the locations for National Tree Day, with past sites including Yeppen Lagoon, Frenchville Road and Remembrance Park in Gracemere," Cr Latcham said. "We can't wait to see everyone at River Rose Drive for this year's event and together help to create canopy cover in the area, build habitat for native wildlife and further enhance the work that Council has been doing in this space lately. "There are three planting sessions that you can choose from – including 8am, 9am and 10am – so head over to the National Tree Day website and register for your preferred time." Paying testament to the event and its benefits, local resident Jeff Krause said this year will mark 20 years of volunteering at National Tree Day events for he and his family. "Our family first became involved with National Tree Day when we supported an event at the Rockhampton Hockey Association fields that aimed to revegetate the banks of Frenchman's Creek and reduce erosion and improve habitat," Mr Krause said. "Since then, I have participated and supported many National Tree Day events, both as an organiser and participant. "It's fun to be with like-minded people and get your hands in the dirt to plant some trees to help improve our local environment. "It is also great to return to these sites over the years to see how the plants have grown and see a native habitat emerging." Mr Krause encouraged the community to take part in the day, whether they have a green thumb or are new to gardening. "You don't need to be a good gardener as there are people to show you what to do and willing to share their expertise," he said. "You may gain some insights into local plants for use in your own garden. "It is also a great family activity – building awareness of the importance of caring for our natural environment and a site that you can revisit in future years to talk about growth and say, 'you planted that tree'." [here](/putting-down-roots-for-national-tree-day-1269910/).

author: E. P.
title: Palestina pide en la ONU parar el genocidio: "Todo el mundo es responsable"
text: Abbas pide a la comunidad internacional dejar de enviar armas a Israel El presidente de la Autoridad Palestina se ha referido a las muertes en la Franja de Gaza y Cisjordania, un "genocidio" del que "todo el mundo es responsable". El presidente de la Autoridad Palestina, Mahmud Abbas, ha pedido este jueves a la comunidad internacional "dejar de enviar armas a Israel" para poner fin cuanto antes a los "crímenes" y la "matanza de niños y mujeres" en la Franja de Gaza y [Cisjordania](https://www.heraldo.es/multimedia/videos/internacional/cisgiordania-soldati-israeliani-gettano-corpi-senza-vita-da-un-tetto-di-un-edificio/), un "genocidio" del que "todo el mundo es responsable". "Párenlo ya. Detengan el asesinato de mujeres y niños. Detengan el genocidio. Dejen de enviar armas a Israel. Esta locura no puede seguir. Todo el mundo es responsable de lo que pasa en Gaza", ha dicho durante su discurso ante la Asamblea General de Naciones Unidas en [Nueva York](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/nueva_york.html), donde ha hecho hincapié en que la población palestina seguirá muriendo a medida que avanza la guerra. Abbas, que ha asegurado que su intención "no es responder a las mentiras del primer ministro israelí", ha acusado directamente al país de estar detrás de la muerte de 15.000 niños gazatíes. "¿Si no fueron ellos, quiénes los mataron?", ha aseverado antes de afirmar que los palestinos "no se marcharán de una tierra que fue primero de sus padres y antes de sus abuelos". En este sentido, ha lamentado que la situación "no hace sino empeorar" para los palestinos, que están siendo "aniquilados". "Se han eliminado los nombres de familias enteras del Registro Civil", ha aclarado, no sin antes afirmar que miles de personas siguen huyendo de las "operaciones sistemáticas que lleva a cabo el Ejército israelí". "Mientras esta guerra de agresión continúa siguen muriendo decenas de personas, y el doble siguen resultado heridas entre este pueblo sufriente de Gaza, Cisjordania y Jerusalén", ha recalcado el dirigente palestino, que ha arremetido contra las acciones de los colonos, que someten al pueblo palestino a una "agresión continua y cotidiana". "Se construye por todas partes, como si Palestina fuera suya", ha criticado. Así se ha pronunciado sobre lo que considera como "actos terroristas" perpetrados por "bandas de colonos bajo el patronato y apoyo del Gobierno israelí y el Ejército ocupante". "Están destruyendo cientos de hogares en las tierras palestinas, por no hablar de (...) las campañas para cambiar la naturaleza de Jerusalén", ha continuado. "Buscan atacar lugares santos a fin de modificar su condición histórica y jurídica", ha manifestado en relación con la mezquita de Al Aqsa. En este sentido, ha hecho un llamamiento a condenar a aquellos altos cargos de [Israel](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/israel.html) que se hacen eco de posturas "imprudentes". "Al Aqsa es propiedad exclusiva de los musulmanes y esto ha sido respaldado por la Sociedad de Naciones desde 1930. (...) No vamos a aceptar ninguna otra cosa con respecto a ello", ha puntualizado. Abbas, que ha pedido nuevamente a Israel acudir a la mesa de negociaciones, ha afirmado que el país tendrá que rendir cuentas antes o después: "si considera que se va a librar de rendir cuentas está equivocado". "La comunidad internacional debe imponer sanciones inmediatamente contra Israel. Todo esto no va a quedar impune. Esto no prescribe", ha aclarado. Implicación de EEUU En este sentido, ha apuntado a [Estados Unidos](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/estados_unidos.html) por su papel en la guerra. "La mayor democracia del mundo ha obstruido en tres ocasiones resoluciones justas en el Consejo de Seguridad, que pedían a Israel el respeto a un alto el fuego", ha relatado. "Estados Unidos permitió que continuará la guerra al hacer uso del veto y, además, a esto hay que sumarle que ha facilitado a Israel las mortíferas armas utilizadas para matar a miles de inocentes, lo que ha envalentonado aún más a Israel", ha manifestado. "Este es Estados Unidos, el mismo país que votó en contra de dar a Palestina la calidad de miembro de pleno derecho en la ONU. Para ellos no nos merecemos la membresía, y no lo entiendo. ¿Cómo puede insistir Estados Unidos en oponerse a nuestro pueblo, en quitarnos nuestro derecho legítimo a la libertad, el mismo derecho que tienen otros países? No somos ni más, ni menos que el resto", ha sostenido. Abbas ha acusado a Israel de estar poniendo en marcha otra agresión contra el "pueblo hermano de Líbano", que es ahora "víctima de otro genocidio", ha argumentado. "Israel tiene que parar la guerra en ambos lugares. Condenamos esta agresión y exigimos que se le ponga final de forma inmediata", ha destacado. A su vez, ha vuelto a subrayar que es Israel el que "se niega a llevar a la práctica las resoluciones de la ONU, por lo que no merece formar parte de esta". "Su representante ha dicho que este mismo edificio debe ser eliminado, lo ha dicho... Este país no se merece formar parte de la ONU", ha insistido. "Desde el inicio, Israel ha incumplido los requisitos necesarios para la membresía. La ONU le pidió dos cosas y no ha cumplido ninguna", ha aseverado antes de recalcar que presentará una solicitud al respecto ante Naciones Unidas, a la que Abbas pide "cumplir las leyes y normas del Derecho Internacional". "No pedimos más de lo que pueden hacer", ha apostillado. Tras el fin de la guerra El presidente de la Autoridad Palestina, que ha asegurado que nunca olvidarán el apoyo de la activista turco-estadounidense Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, que murió a manos de las fuerzas israelíes en Cisjordania, ha explicado que, una vez finalice la guerra, Palestina "buscará un alto el fuego total y el fin de la agresión militar". El plan de doce puntos de las autoridades palestinas, ha apuntado, incluye la entrada de ayuda humanitaria, que "debe darse de forma urgente y organizada, en cantidades suficientes". Además, espera una "retirada plena y total de la Franja de Gaza". "Nos negamos a que se establezcan zonas tapón, a que se sustraiga alguna zona. No van a quedarse un solo centímetro de Gaza", ha señalado. "En tercer lugar, solicitamos que se detengan los desplazamientos forzosos y que vuelvan los desplazados a sus casas, que se les facilite una vivienda. [Netanyahu](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/personas/benjamin_netanyahu.html) quiere que el pueblo de Gaza y Cisjordania sea evacuado a Egipto y Jordania: nos negamos. Los gobiernos de [Egipto](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/egipto.html) y [Jordania](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/jordania.html), a los que damos las gracias, no van a permitir el desplazamiento de ningún palestino ni que sean expulsados de sus tierras", ha explicado. Es por ello que ha pedido la protección de organizaciones humanitarias que prestan ayuda sobre el terreno, para que "puedan seguir trabajando". "Exigimos la protección internacional para los palestinos en zonas ocupadas", ha declarado, al tiempo que ha recordado que los palestinos "no están luchando contra Israel", a quien "no pueden combatir". "Lo que queremos es protección. Queremos que nuestros hijos y familias estén protegidos internacionalmente. El Estado de [Palestina](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/palestina.html) debe asumir sus responsabilidades en Gaza e imponer su mandato total y jurisdicción sobre Gaza, también en los cruces fronterizos. Debemos volver a esto", ha resaltado. Para Abas, los únicos representantes legítimos del pueblo palestino son la Autoridad Palestina y la OLP. "Estos tendrán autoridad sobre todos los territorios palestinos, como se estipuló y como estipula el Derecho Internacional. No pedimos más, pero no vamos a aceptar menos", ha expresado. En este sentido, ha dicho estar preparado para la celebración de elecciones. "Ya lo estábamos antes, pero Israel se niega a que las celebremos en Jerusalén. Estamos dispuestos", ha proclamado, no sin antes instar a la celebración de una conferencia de paz internacional en un plazo máximo de un año para lograr la aplicación de la solución de dos Estados. "Queremos que haya fuerzas de paz internacionales aprobadas por el Consejo de Seguridad que garantice la protección de ambos países (...) porque nosotros sí reconocemos el Estado de Israel y queremos una solución que aporte estabilidad y seguridad para las dos partes", ha demandado.

author: Owen Siebring
title: College Coach of the Century #7: UNI's Chris Bucknam - NewsBreak
text:
cbs2iowa.com
website
Cedar Falls
College Coach of the Century #7: UNI's Chris Bucknam
By Owen Siebring,
3 hours agoCEDAR FALLS, Iowa — One of the best NCAA track coaches in DI history, Chris Bucknam is our #7 college coach of the century. Bucky was UNI's men's track coach from 1984-2008, and the women's coach from 1997-2008. Over that time he won33 MVC coach of the year awards and 20 conference championships.

author: elperiodic.com
title: El Ayuntamiento incorpora a 36 personas en un nuevo taller de Empleo
text: El Ayuntamiento incorpora a 36 personas en un nuevo taller de Empleo El concejal de Empleo, Juan Carlos Redondo, pone en valor la preparación formativa de estas personas para ayudarles a encontrar empleo estable y de calidad que generan las empresas El edil de empleo en el Ayuntamiento de Castellón, Juan Carlos Redondo ha puesto en valor la importancia de la formación y preparación de los trabajadores para ampliar sus posibilidades en la búsqueda de empleo, “hoy empieza una andadura que supone el inicio de un camino en el que vais a adquirir competencias profesionales y múltiples aprendizajes, que sin duda influirán en la mejora de vuestra empleabilidad y cualificación profesional, para encontrar empleo”. El edil ha hecho estas declaraciones en el acto de inicio del Taller de Empleo 15, dentro del Programa Mixto de Empleo y Formación, en el que un total de 36 personas han sido seleccionadas para realizar formación y prácticas durante un año, en las instalaciones del Centro Municipal de Formación Tetuan XIV. Redondo ha destacado que “el objetivo de este gobierno es la puesta en marcha de iniciativas enfocadas a generar oportunidades laborales y para ello es fundamental la formación”. Del mismo modo, recuerda que “estamos en contacto permanente con el tejido empresarial castellonenses para ofrecerles una formación a la carta, de manera que los perfiles profesionales se ajusten a su demanda facilitando la inserción laboral”. Tres especialidades Hoy han dado comienzo tres especialidades formativas; Albañilería, Instalaciones caloríficas y Agricultura ecológica y para su puesta en marcha han sido contratadas 36 personas, entre alumnado y personal trabajador. El edil ha animado a todos los alumnos a “exprimir esta experiencia, aprender, trabajar y dar lo mejor de vosotros mismos”, porque de ello dependerá su posible incorporación en las empresas.

author: Luis del Barco
title: El plan maestro de Apple es añadir IA a todos sus Mac gracias a un nuevo chip, y ya sabemos cuándo ocurrirá
text:
Los próximos iMac, MacBook y Mac mini de Apple llevarán un chip enfocado en la inteligencia artificial. Tendrá el nombre de M4 —la evolución natural de los presentes M3— y todo apunta a que serán otros de los protagonistas de la
WWDC 2024 del próximo mes de junio.
Este sería uno de los movimientos de la firma de Cupertino para levantar las ventas de su gama de dispositivos Mac, que pasa por un momento de cierto letargo. Y es que las nuevas máquinas que han llegado con los chips M3 en los meses recientes no son tan atractivas, en muchos casos, como lo fueron las de la anterior generación. En algunos casos,
resulta incluso más recomendable el modelo anterior que el nuevo.
Nuevo chip M4 para Mac con IA
Aunque es de esperar que las mejoras en los nuevos chips M4 de Apple sean varias, desde
Bloomberg apuntan que la inteligencia artificial tendrá un peso destacado. Y es por ello que esta generación de chips es de las que se anticipan como significativas, más que la presente M3.
Apple llevará sus chips M4 a la totalidad de su gama de Mac, empezando con los iMac y MacBook Pro a finales de este mismo año. En 2025 se renovarían los MacBook Air y mac mini con este mismo chip.
El mismo tendrá 3 variantes diferentes dependiendo de la máquina a la que vaya destinado y el público potencial de la misma, como ya ocurre en el presente. Entre las diferencias que se podrán encontrar, por ejemplo, estará la capacidad de RAM total que podrá tener el equipo, que pasaría de los 192 GB actuales en los Mac Pro y Mac Studio a un máximo de 512 GB en los nuevos modelos.
La IA es clave para Apple, no solo en el Mac
La gran estrella de este año para Apple será la IA. A la tecnológica se le achaca de llegar tarde a la sensación de la industria, y espera dar un golpe en la mesa con avances en sus próximos terminales y actualización de software. Por eso, los Mac son solo una pieza más en la que se incluyen también, como no podía ser de otro modo, productos como el
iPhone 16.
La citada conferencia para desarrolladores WWDC 2024 es el escenario elegido, y allí será cuando los de la manzana revelen qué es aquello en lo que están trabajando. Todo ello, eso sí, empezará a estar disponible para el gran público con la llegada de nuevos dispositivos y software después del verano.

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: What colors induce anxiety?
text:
Colors and Anxiety: Unveiling the Palette of Distress Colors possess an incredible power, capable of influencing our moods, emotions, and even our physiological responses. While some hues evoke feelings of peace and tranquility, others can trigger anxiety, stress, and unease. So, what colors induce anxiety ? Generally, bright, bold, and highly saturated colors are more likely to trigger anxiety . Specifically, red, orange, and yellow are often cited as anxiety-inducing colors . However, the effect of color is highly subjective and can be influenced by personal experiences, cultural associations, and individual sensitivities.
The Anxious Spectrum: How Colors Affect Us The relationship between color and anxiety is complex, nuanced, and deeply personal. It’s not simply a matter of one color being universally anxiety-inducing. It’s about the intensity, context, and individual interpretation of those colors .
Red: The Color of Alert and Agitation Red is perhaps the most frequently cited color associated with anxiety. Its association with danger, emergencies, and heightened arousal can easily trigger a stress response. Think of flashing emergency lights, warning signs, and the expression “seeing red.” This powerful color can elevate heart rate, increase blood pressure, and stimulate the fight-or-flight response, making it a potent anxiety trigger. However, in some cultures, red symbolizes good luck and prosperity, highlighting the importance of cultural context.
Orange: A Stimulating and Overwhelming Hue Like red, orange is a stimulating color that can be overwhelming for some individuals. Its vibrancy and intensity can create a sense of unease and agitation, especially in individuals prone to anxiety. Orange is often associated with warning signs and construction zones, further contributing to its potential to induce stress.
Yellow: The Paradoxical Color of Joy and Anxiety While yellow is often associated with happiness, optimism, and energy , it can also trigger anxiety in certain individuals. Its high-energy nature can be overstimulating, leading to feelings of unease and restlessness. Some studies have also linked yellow to overthinking and irritability, particularly in those already experiencing anxiety. The brightness of yellow can also be visually fatiguing, contributing to feelings of stress.
The Role of Context and Personal Experience It’s crucial to remember that color associations are highly subjective. A person who had a traumatic experience involving a particular color may develop an aversion to it. Similarly, cultural associations can play a significant role. For example, white is associated with purity and peace in Western cultures, but it symbolizes mourning in some Eastern cultures.
Finding Your Calm: Using Color to Manage Anxiety While certain colors can trigger anxiety, others can promote relaxation and calm. Blue, green, and lavender are often recommended for creating a soothing environment. These colors have been shown to lower heart rate, reduce blood pressure, and promote feelings of peace and tranquility. Incorporating these colors into your home, workspace, or wardrobe can be a simple yet effective way to manage anxiety. You might find that resources on The Environmental Literacy Council , available at enviroliteracy.org , provide insights into how our environment, including color, impacts our wellbeing.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Here are 15 frequently asked questions about the relationship between color and anxiety, providing further insights into this fascinating topic.
1. Are color associations universal, or are they culturally determined? Color associations are a blend of both universal and culturally determined factors. Some associations, like red being linked to danger, are rooted in human biology and survival instincts. However, many other associations are learned through cultural norms, traditions, and personal experiences.
2. Can the intensity of a color affect its impact on anxiety levels? Absolutely. Highly saturated, bright, and intense colors are more likely to trigger anxiety than muted, pastel, or desaturated shades . A vibrant, fire-engine red will likely have a stronger impact than a soft, dusty rose.
3. What colors are generally considered calming and anxiety-reducing? Blue, green, lavender, and soft pastels are generally considered calming and anxiety-reducing colors. These hues are often associated with nature, peace, and tranquility.
4. Does the environment in which a color is used influence its effect on anxiety? Yes, the environment plays a crucial role. A bright red wall in a hospital waiting room is likely to be more anxiety-inducing than a red accent pillow in a cozy living room. Context is key.
5. How can I use color to create a more relaxing home environment? Incorporate calming colors like blue, green, and lavender into your walls, furniture, and accessories. Use soft lighting and natural textures to further enhance the sense of peace and tranquility.
6. Are there specific colors that are known to trigger panic attacks? While there’s no definitive list, intense shades of red and orange are often reported as triggers for panic attacks, particularly in individuals with pre-existing anxiety disorders.
7. Can color therapy be used to treat anxiety disorders? Color therapy, also known as chromotherapy, is a complementary therapy that uses colors to balance energy and promote healing. While it may be helpful for some individuals with anxiety, it’s essential to consult with a qualified mental health professional for evidence-based treatment.
8. How does color affect children with anxiety? Children are often more sensitive to color than adults. Bright and stimulating colors can be overstimulating for children with anxiety, while calming colors can create a sense of safety and security.
9. Are there any colors that are specifically associated with depression? While not directly causing depression, studies suggest people with depression may gravitate toward gray or muted colors , reflecting a lack of energy and enthusiasm.
10. Can the color of my clothing affect my anxiety levels? Yes, the colors you wear can influence your mood and confidence levels. Wearing calming colors can help you feel more relaxed and grounded, while wearing bold colors can boost your energy and self-esteem. However, it’s essential to choose colors that make you feel comfortable and confident.
11. What role does personal preference play in color-related anxiety? Personal preference is paramount. What one person finds calming, another might find boring or depressing. It’s essential to experiment with different colors to discover what works best for you.
12. Are there any studies that scientifically prove the link between color and anxiety? Numerous studies have explored the relationship between color and emotions. While the exact mechanisms are still being investigated, research suggests that color can influence physiological responses, brain activity, and subjective feelings.
13. Can I use color to improve my focus and concentration? Yes, certain colors can enhance focus and concentration. Blue and green are often recommended for workspaces as they promote a sense of calm and mental clarity.
14. How can I identify my personal color triggers for anxiety? Pay attention to how you feel when you’re exposed to different colors. Keep a journal to track your emotional responses to various hues. Over time, you’ll likely notice patterns and identify your personal color triggers.
15. Where can I learn more about the psychology of color? Numerous books, articles, and websites explore the psychology of color. Look for resources from reputable sources, such as universities, research institutions, and professional organizations. You can explore websites like The Environmental Literacy Council , enviroliteracy.org , for links to additional resources on the impact of our environment on mental wellbeing.
Understanding the relationship between color and anxiety can empower you to create a more supportive and calming environment for yourself and others. By being mindful of the colors around you, you can harness their power to promote well-being and reduce stress.

author: 台北時報
title: Religious celebration
text:
People dressed as Taiwanese folk deities representing divine soldiers gather at Sunflower Plaza in New Taipei City’s Sanchong District yesterday for Sian Ciang Temple’s 24th Shennong Cultural Festival. The procession, which drew 270 people in Taiwanese folk deity costumes, is celebrating the temple’s 270th anniversary this year.
Photo: Tung Kuan-yi, Taipei Times
A tropical depression east of China’s Hainan Province is poised to strengthen into the second tropical storm of this year, the Central Weather Administration (CWA) said yesterday. The storm, which could be upgraded into a tropical storm before noon today, would be named Maliksi, meaning “brisk” in Filipino. As of 2pm, the tropical depression was moving northwest at 12kph, CWA data showed. The moisture the storm carries is likely to move east and merge with a weather front that is closing in on Taiwan, bringing rain over the weekend, CWA forecaster Huang En-hung (黃恩鴻) said. Tropical Storm Ewiniar is also nearby, although it would
The Ministry of Agriculture yesterday urged people not to buy zongzi (粽子, glutinous rice dumplings wrapped in bamboo leaves) or pork products from other countries ahead of next week’s Dragon Boat Festival, or risk a fine of NT$200,000 (US$6,214). Local Chinese-language media outlets on Sunday reported that an Indonesian traveler was fined NT$200,000 upon their arrival in Taiwan from Hong Kong on April 30 for attempting to take their in-flight meal, which contained pork, through customs. The traveler had packed their in-flight meal, which included roasted pork and chicken, in a container to take through customs, which is against regulations, the reports
The government has reduced the proportion of runaway Southeast Asian tourists from group tours to nine in 10,000 by better managing which travel agencies are used, the Tourism Administration said. The Project for Simplifying Visa Regulations for High-end Group Tourists from Southeast Asian Countries, also known as the Kuan Hung Pilot Project (觀宏專案), was launched in 2015 to attract tourists from Cambodia, India, Indonesia, Laos, Myanmar and Vietnam in line with the government’s New Southbound Policy. Tourists from these countries can visit Taiwan on an electronic visa, which they obtain by participating in group tours organized by travel agencies designated by
Singer and actor Aaron Yan (炎亞綸) was given a seven-month suspended prison sentence yesterday for filming and leaking intimate videos of a minor in 2017 and 2018. In its ruling, the Shilin District Court said that Yan, 39, had recorded the videos of him having sex with a minor with the intention of sharing them. The court handed down a seven-month prison sentence, which was suspended for three years and can be commuted to a fine, after Yan reached a settlement in March with the accuser, an Internet personality named Raku (耀樂), the ruling said. The amount of the settlement was not disclosed,
